page.title: 03Ryde in Edwardian times
page.content: { Mr.Jolliffe}came to talk to us today . He was born in{Ryde in 1902}and when he grew up he ran the family grocery shop at the corner of{Green Street and {High Street.}In his shop everything was loose so he had to weigh everything himself in{pounds and {ounces}then he put them into bags. When{Mr.Joliffe}went to school if he got his spellings wrong they had to write it out at home{50 times.}At home when they wanted a bath they had to go down stairs to get the hot water,then go all the way back up stairs to put the water in the bath. The games he liked to play on the road were{marbles and whip and top. {Schools were so cold}that children would take an old cocoa tin filled with smouldering rags to use as a{hand {warmer. }
